projectDesc.p: "The Wessobrun Prayer" is published by The Global Medieval Sourcebook (GMS), a free, open access, and open source compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. GMS comprises computer-readable transcriptions or editions alongside new translations of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. The GMS platform includes critical introductions as well as sources for further reading.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern American English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Scribal errors and creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: Of the Creator / The Wessobrun Prayer

app.lem: Dat gafregin ih mit firahim firiuuizzo meista,
app.rdg: This I learned among men as the greatest wonder,

app.lem: dat ero ni uuas noh ûfhimil,
app.rdg: That [once] there was neither earth nor heaven above,

app.lem: noh paum ... noh pereg ni uuas,
app.rdg: Nor was there tree or mountain

app.lem: ni ... nohheinîig noh sunna ni scein,
app.rdg: No….[undecipherable] anything, nor did the sun shine

app.lem: no mâno ni liuhta, noh der mâreo sêo.
app.rdg: No moon did glow, nor [was there] the splendid sea.

app.lem: Dô dâr niuuiht ni uuas enteo ni uuenteo,
app.rdg: When there was nothing, there was no end and no change,

app.lem: enti dô uuas der eino almahtîco cot,
app.rdg: There was the one almighty God,

app.lem: manno miltisto, enti dâr uuârun auh manake mit inan
app.rdg: Of all the most generous, and there
were with him many glorious spirits. And holy God…

app.lem: Cot almahtico, du himil enti erda gaworachtos, enti du
app.rdg: Almighty God you created heaven and earth, and you

app.lem: mannun so manac coot forgapi, forgip mir in dino ganada rehta
app.rdg: have given men so many good gifts. In your mercy, give me the right

app.lem: galaupa enti cotan willeon, wistom enti spachida enti craft,
app.rdg: faith and good will, wisdom and cleverness and strength

app.lem: tiuflun za widarstantanne, enti arc za piwisanne endi dinan
